simplified: Sometimes, dreams show us what's on our minds, even if we don't know it. Common dreams like being able to fly or falling, your teeth falling out or having no clothes on in a public place probably mean something similar in most people.  But the key to understanding exactly what they mean to you is to connect them to the events and feelings in your daily life.

Many people find the wild dogs in Moscow to be a fascinating example of urban wildlife. Around 35,000 wild dogs live in the streets of Moscow. Some dogs were born in the wild. Other dogs were once pets, but their owners left them. Some dogs live by themselves, and some live with other dogs. In 2010, scientists studied dogs. They found dogs live well in cities. They found it's safer to cross the road with others. Some dogs understand when to cross based on the traffic lights.

Wonder is New Yorker RJ Palacio's first novel.  A girl she saw on the street inspired her book. She shared this story on her website. Many people in the United States like to read "Wonder." It is an award-winning book. This is a good way for schools to discuss important topics like bullying, friendship, and diversity. A film version is being made, and many, including me, are waiting eagerly to see what RJ Palacio writes next.

Chloe’s pets are two rats: Zena and Roxy. Rats are not usual pets, and Chloe knows this. She has lost track of how many times she’s explained to people that rats are clean and good companions when properly cared for. But she understands why people react badly.  She didn't like rats either until her friend Martin showed her his pet rats and she saw how affectionate and intelligent they were.  Last year, when one of Martin's rats had babies, Chloe decided she'd like to have two of them.

Cape Town can be risky for baboons. People have been hurt or died in car crashes. Others died after touching electric wires while playing. Baboons need protection. The city council hired a team to help the baboons and avoid conflicts with people. Baboons are sometimes found in cities. Monitors try to send them back to the countryside. This policy has had some success, though it is proving hard to stop baboons from coming back to the city once they see it as a source of easy food.

My company is a global IT business. I work at home using the internet, as the main office is located in the USA. I don't spend time traveling to work or talking about unimportant things with coworkers. I prefer project work because it lets me manage my time. I can take time off for family and personal appointments when needed. Without clear work hours, I often continue working in the evening and may not eat dinner.

Graffiti was still being made in the 1990s. However, street art became very popular in many countries. Artists used art to talk about politics. They wanted people to think about war and unfairness. These street artists wanted to make art that was beautiful and caught the eye. In South America, many street artists painted poor neighborhoods. They added color and beauty to the walls.

Every day, ads on social media, in magazines, and in shops try to get people to buy things. Because of this, people in Britain are buying more clothes and shoes. Online stores let customers buy easily. Clothes from big brands are so cheap that people often throw them away after only a few uses.

Sam shielded his eyes from the sun and watched a car drive up to the big house, leaving a trail of dust. The horses kicked and flicked their tails at flies, not caring about their owner's first visit in ten months.  Sam waited. Mr. Carter only came when he had to, and this suited Sam perfectly. The less his boss noticed him, the more secure his job was. Mr. Carter felt hot and wiped his neck. The wet areas on his shirt formed shapes, like those you see in a book of maps. His skin was becoming red from the June sun. He looked like someone who got rich without working hard himself.

Many people in Berlin did not like that hunters were shooting pigs, because they thought it was cruel. There were strong disagreements between the hunters and those who love animals. In response to protests, the city council decided to take more peaceful action against pigs.  Instead of shooting them, they have put up fences and made it illegal to feed the pigs.  We need to wait and see if the strategy works. Warmer winters are leading to larger pig populations, which may make success harder.

An important inspiration for the Hunger Games book comes from Suzanne's love of classical Greek mythology.  She loved hearing about Theseus and the Minotaur as a child. Crete controls Athens, but the Athenians disagree and rebel. Minos, the king of Crete, made Athens send young people as a punishment. Every year, they had to send seven boys and seven girls. The maze holds a dangerous monster, the Minotaur, which kills anyone who enters. A young man named Theseus killed the Minotaur. Suzanne sees Katniss  Everdeen is a future version of the hero Theseus.

Zoos can educate people about why it’s important to protect animals and their environments. Animals mistreated in circuses or left by their owners can find safety in some zoos. Zoos also carry out important research into subjects like animal behaviour and how to treat illnesses.

Some people are starting to reject buying many things. This is known as the 'buy nothing' movement. The idea originated in Canada in the early 1990s and then moved to the US, where it became a rejection of the overspending and overconsumption of Black Friday and Cyber Monday during Thanksgiving weekend.  People protest on Buy Nothing Day. Some cancel their credit cards as part of the protest. Throughout the year, Buy n Large was very innovative. They created a new technology to help with limited resources. However, this technology also gave the company too much power, and eventually led to people leaving Earth. No groups exist to help with trading or fixing used items.

We often ask: is graffiti art, or is it simply destruction? Whether you agree or not, many countries see writing or painting on buildings as vandalism. Street artists sometimes get in trouble with the police and may have to pay fines. City councils often say it costs a lot to remove graffiti from buildings, buses, and trains.

What is the art world’s opinion on graffiti and street art? Recently, there has been a growing recognition of its value as an art form.  There have been major exhibitions of street art in galleries in Paris, London and Los Angeles.  Elura Emerald, an artist from America, organized a public art display at a gallery in New York City in 2008. She supported street artists. She said they are just expressing their ideas, and not causing harm. It is important to appreciate and celebrate them.

If most people have four to six dreams every night after the age of ten, that's as many as 2,000 dreams per year.  People usually have about 140,000 dreams by the time they are 80 years old. Even if we forget 95–99 per cent of our dreams, that's still a few thousand remembered dreams across a lifetime.  Dreams and real life can sometimes match, especially for common things. This can happen by accident.

The story of The Hunger Games happens after North America is destroyed. This country, called Panem, has twelve poor areas. A wealthy city, the Capitol, governs these areas. The Capitol controls the country. The Capitol gets different goods from each area. District 12 is where the story starts. It provides coal for the whole country. It fought against the Capitol a long time ago.

Animals from the wild often enter cities because they are hungry. Baboons are now entering neighborhoods in Cape Town, South Africa, to find food. They eat fruit from gardens and farms, and they also search trash for food. Some baboons are bold enough to enter houses and steal food from kitchens and refrigerators. Baboons can be aggressive towards pets. This is why many people who live in the city don’t want baboons nearby.

Building a bridge can be dangerous, and many accidents occur. Often, these accidents are the result of mistakes made by engineers when they calculate things. The bridge collapses under its own weight, and this can be deadly for the workers on it at the time.

George Lucas built his stories around a well-known pattern called the hero's journey. The story often starts with a hero who has a normal life. Something unexpected happens, and the hero goes on an adventure that changes everything. Luke starts Star Wars living a normal life with his aunt and uncle. He fixes robots. R2D2 has a message for Obi-Wan Kenobi. This message tells the hero to start his adventure.

A way to stop a dangerous asteroid from hitting Earth is to explode a nuclear weapon near it. This idea sounds like something from a movie, like the film *Armageddon* from 1998. But NASA really proposed a plan called HAMMER. Big rockets, weighing eight tons, would be launched at the asteroid to try and change its path. The plan needed a safe distance from Earth. If the asteroid was too close, we would use bombs on rockets to explode it.

Heroes usually don’t accept their quest right away, Campbell explains. A teacher or guide then helps them, and they start their journey into a new world. The hero must pass tests and fight battles. They will also meet new friends before facing a major challenge. Luke’s mentor is Obi-Wan. He is friends with Han Solo, R2D2, and C3PO. Darth Vader is his enemy, and the story happens on the Death Star.

Things we don’t use much can be valuable to others. Online communities now make money using the internet by sharing things people rarely use. Websites and social media help people trade with each other. People refer to this as the sharing economy.

During the 18th and 19th centuries, two popular beliefs about dreams developed. One was the idea that the things we see in our dreams represent things hidden from our conscious mind.  Freud thought dreams give us clues about our feelings. These feelings can cause problems if we don't understand them. However, the other theory was the opposite.  Dreams are a result of the brain working to organize your daily experiences and memories. After we wake up, we try to find meaning in our dreams.

I am a freelancer, so I work independently. This is great because I am in control of what I do and how I spend my time.  First, I worked at home. But I had trouble focusing. Many things kept me from working. These included chores, wanting tea, and family requests. I began to work in a café. The internet was slow, and I drank too much coffee as a result. I decided to rent a desk to work in with five other people who work for themselves. I enjoyed getting ready for work and concentrating at the office.

If NASA gets funding, it can build NEOCam. This space telescope will find medium-sized asteroids using infrared light. Getting the money would help it achieve its goal within ten years. When they logged in, the planet defense team had to plan how to avoid being hit by dangerous asteroids, called PHAs.

These influencers usually recommend products, but now they are sharing about not buying things. Some popular YouTubers now tell their fans to stop buying things for up to a year. Two friends in Canada worked for a year to earn money for food. For the first three months, they stopped buying electricity, clothes, and household items. Next, they stopped using some services. These included haircuts, restaurants, and gas for cars. In a year, they were able to save $55,000.

Pi finds religion to be important in his life. Even though he was raised Hindu, he likes to explore different religions. He is friends with a priest who is Christian and a baker who is Muslim. Pi unexpectedly states he follows all three religions: Hinduism, Islam, and Christianity. People asked Pi to choose a religion, but he didn’t want to. He wanted to feel love for God. They allowed him to form his own religious opinions after that point.

People believe that keeping a dream journal can lead to lucid dreaming. You are aware you're dreaming in a lucid dream. This lets you control the dream's events. You can either make a scary dream feel safe, or you can decide what happens in it. You will not just analyze your dreams, but also create them yourself.

People may not know they contribute to clothing waste, even when they give old clothes to charity. Charity shops cannot sell all clothes people don't want. Because fast fashion is a quick trend, it doesn’t stay popular for long. It’s also often too cheap to recycle, and people don’t want to buy it used. Much waste is discarded, and unsold charity clothes are exported. This causes economic and environmental damage in other countries.

Not content with one amazing trip, some of today's adventurers go from challenge to challenge.  Meagan McGrath from Canada has climbed the highest mountain on each continent, ridden a bike across Canada and run a long-distance race in the Sahara Desert in 45ºC heat.  But perhaps her most remarkable journey was a skiing trip to the South Pole.  She fell into a glacier on the first day. Someone rescued her. It was hard, but Meagan didn’t stop – she continued. She arrived at the South Pole forty days later. She pulled a sled with a tent and food behind her. The weather was very cold with ice storms.

Blek le Rat began his art by painting rats on Paris walls. He now works to raise awareness of social problems. He creates art about people who don't have homes in large cities, hoping it will make people consider the problem.

In some areas, councils have tried to encourage artists not to paint graffiti randomly on walls by allowing them to work in designated areas.  In Taiwan, there are areas where artists are allowed to paint on walls. Some graffiti artists can now paint on trains in São Paulo, Brazil, because the city council agreed to it.

Faith47 comes from South Africa. Her hometown is Cape Town. She creates colorful paintings of people and animals. She enjoys exploring new places too. Her artwork is displayed on streets, in empty factories, and on abandoned cars. She likes that street art is not permanent. The weather or city cleaners will take it down. To her, this means life is full of change, like a circle of endings and beginnings.

In her previous work environment, Gabriela was used to a high power distance culture where power and authority are respected and everyone has their rightful place.  In this society, leaders decide things, and people rarely question their choices. Swedish culture encourages teamwork between employees and bosses. Her team was familiar with this way of working. Here, leaders act as coaches or mentors who encourage independent thought and expect to be challenged.

Gabriela learned about cultural differences with her team. She then asked them for their honest opinions about her leadership style. Gabriela’s team was happy to speak. They explained they usually decide things themselves. They were happy to have more freedom to make their own decisions and be imaginative. She told the team how to do their work. This made them feel she didn’t have confidence in them. Gabriela got upset when people disagreed with her decisions. They told her they always discuss ideas this way.

Os Gêmeos are identical twin brothers from São Paulo.  They create art on buildings, including simple tags and large, colorful portraits. Because their projects are large, they need cranes. In 2007, people painted an entire castle in Scotland.

Humans have always painted and written on walls. In prehistoric times, people in Africa and Europe used to paint pictures of animals and people in caves.  Someone wrote graffiti on old buildings in Greece, Italy, Syria, and Iraq. People wrote on walls in Pompeii, an ancient Roman town, and archaeologists found this writing. They include messages about faith, government, and feelings. Some are like spells.

Have you ever imagined climbing Mount Everest or traveling to the South Pole? If that is the case, many other people feel the same way. People all over the world try to climb the highest mountains and walk across continents every year. Unlike the explorers of the past who used maps and compasses, today's adventurers travel with modern technology like GPS and satellite phones.  Many people who travel enjoy nature. They often try to help the environment or raise money for charities.

DART is a test to change the path of an asteroid. It's called the Double Asteroid Redirection Test. They are planning a test of DART. The test will happen on a moon around the asteroid Didymos. This asteroid, called 'Didymoon', is 150 meters wide. It travels around a larger asteroid. A spacecraft will hit 'Didymoon' to change where it goes. Scientists will watch this from Earth with telescopes.

Katniss Everdeen is sixteen years old and the main character. She needs to find food for her family because her father died in a mining accident. She hunts in the forest near District 12 with her friend. Gale learns to use a bow and arrow very well. Prim, Katniss’s younger sister, was chosen for a competition. Katniss decided to go instead of her. Peeta is the other person chosen from District 12. Katniss develops a difficult relationship with him.

When you write down a dream, you'll probably recall more of it. The people and places in the dream might also be important for understanding it. You'll be surprised how much you can write if you write for a week. Now you can start connecting your dreams to the events and feelings in your daily life.
Bridges used to be made of wood, and wood burns quickly. Old train bridges were especially likely to catch fire. The wheels and tracks made sparks that could burn the bridge down.

We don’t know how street art will change, but some trends are becoming clear. While most street artists are young people who paint in their city or neighbourhood, more and more street artists are travelling and working around the globe.  Other artists are using the internet to talk to each other and share photos of their work.  The art world is starting to see street art as true art. We are not sure about the future of street art. However, it will continue to be popular.

Suzanne Collins feels sad when she watches news about wars. When she was a child, her father was a pilot in the US Air Force and he fought in Vietnam.  Her mother wanted to keep her safe from the war, so she didn't talk about it. But the girl still watched news about the war and knew her father was fighting there. She was really frightened.

In a global survey conducted by PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC), more than 40,000 millennial (born between 1983 and 1993) and non-millennial responses were collected on the topics of workplace culture, communication and working styles, pay structure, career development, work–life balance, etc.  In a separate global survey conducted by Deloitte, more than 10,000 millennials participated in a study about their perceptions of the threats and opportunities in the complex world of work.

From the United States, Erik Weihenmayer enjoys many adventures. He's ridden a bike through the deserts of Morocco, kayaked through the Grand Canyon and climbed Everest.  Erik became blind at age 13 and remains blind today. He travels a lot. He also helps people with disabilities be active. He takes young, blind people on climbing trips.

Online platforms are now open to everyone, and people can easily earn a little money using them. Selling children’s used items was hard for busy parents. Online sales now make it simple to sell clothes, strollers, and other baby equipment for money.

For over seven months, Pi and Richard Parker shared a lifeboat. They experience hunger, sickness, and tiredness. They experience bad weather and intense heat, yet they manage to survive. Pi is comforted by his religions at times, yet he also experiences loneliness and despair. After a long time, the Mexican coast appears, and this makes a big change. I won’t spoil the ending for you. You can find out what happens to Pi and Richard Parker by reading the book when they see land.

Chloe came home from school. She made coffee for herself. Then, she took the coffee to her bedroom. She had assignments for school, and she didn't need to do them right away. She hoped to relax for an hour before her house became noisy with family activity. She enjoyed this time of day, as she could play with her rats.

NASA found 90% of the big asteroids close to Earth by 2010. They were 1 kilometer across. We call objects near Earth “NEOs.” These objects can be very big, like mountains. They are less than 50 million kilometers from Earth. Scientists at NASA are looking for about 50 more asteroids. They have already found 887, and none of them are a big risk to Earth.

Auggie is going to school. His first day will be a challenge. He is anxious because he is starting a new school. He feels great pain because people judge him by how he looks. Kids don't like to sit beside him, and he realizes they watch and gossip about him. He was happy to make friends with Jack and Summer. Jack is in his class, and Summer is someone he talks to at lunch. But it's not just the first day that's hard.  Auggie quickly finds out his classmates are afraid to touch him. Auggie has a difficult school year with many good and bad moments.

The two men looked towards the northern end of the property.  It was very large and continued far away. Even the fences were barely visible from where they stood.  Teenage boys sometimes get bored and rebel, but they couldn't escape by walking. Sam watched the biggest horse. It stamped its large hooves on the ground. Was the boy able to ride? He didn't know and wanted to find out. It was easy to find problems for skilled horse riders in this faraway place. But maybe there was even more trouble for someone who knew nothing about horses and wanted to get away from his father.

Over 4,000 climbers, aged from thirteen to eighty have been to the top of Everest.  High mountain climbing in freezing storms remains dangerous. Still, experienced climbers want to try even harder climbs. When she was young, Gerlinde Kaltenbrunner, an Austrian woman, started climbing mountains and loved it. When she left school, she worked as a nurse, but kept climbing in her free time.

Gerlinde climbed Mount Everest. Then, she decided to climb all fourteen mountains in the world that are over 8,000 meters high. To increase the challenge, Gerlinde climbs without using oxygen tanks.  This is risky as low oxygen levels at the top of high mountains can affect brain and body functioning.  Gerlinde is a well-known climber who helps children in Nepal. She supports a charity that works with poor children and orphans.

If we look around us at the things we have purchased at some point in our lives, we would no doubt notice that not everything we own is being put to good use: the thick woollen coat which we thought looked trendy despite the fact that we live in a tropical country, the smartphone that got put away when we bought ourselves the newest model, the car that only gets used at the weekends, or even the guest room in our house that somehow got turned into a storeroom.

In the past, many cultures connected dreams to predictions about the future. People believed dreams came from gods. They thought dreams gave us understanding or helpful advice. Today, lots of people can remember dreaming about something and then experiencing it later.

Big transportation projects often cost a lot of money, and they sometimes involve building bridges. Bridges are needed to move vehicles. They go over water, mountains, and roads. Because of this, they are very important in building things like roads and bridges. People carefully check them, especially if one breaks or falls down.

For weeks, Gabriela was unhappy with her team’s work. So, she emailed her manager, who is from Sweden, about it. Her manager asked her two questions. First, he wanted to know if she thought her team was doing well. Second, he asked what could help her work better with her teammates. Gabriela felt her manager didn't explain things well and wasn't solving the problem.

So, the groups use the cute dogs to get food for all of them. Some dogs are smart enough to use the metro. This helps them travel across the city. We don't understand how dogs learn when to exit the train. They have a good sense of smell and can remember the smells of places they like. It is possible they learned the names of stations by hearing them announced. Dogs are common on the metro, so people don’t usually pay attention to them.

Ed Stafford is from the UK. He was the first person to walk the entire Amazon River. He started by a small stream in the Andes mountains of Peru and arrived at the river's mouth in Brazil, two years and four months later, having walked 6,000 kilometres.  The Amazon rainforest is home to poisonous snakes, crocodiles and jaguars, so Ed was in constant danger.  He survived, and only had some mosquito and ant bites.

A typical person in Britain spends over £1,000 on clothes every year. This amount is about four percent of their income. It doesn't seem like a lot, but this number hides two serious issues for society and nature. Credit cards are a common way for people to buy things. Credit card debt in Britain is about £670 per person. This represents 66% of the money people spend on their clothes. People are borrowing money to buy things they don’t need. Britain throws away 300,000 tons of clothing a year, most of which goes into landfill sites.

Without technology, Ed would not have been able to walk. He asked for help from the rainforest people using a radio. He needed food and wanted to cross their land. People came to see him and helped him through the hardest parts of the land. As he walked Ed wrote a blog, recording his day-to-day experiences.  He used the media interest in his trip to protest about the destruction of the rainforest and raise money for environmental and children's charities in Brazil and Peru.

The sharing economy is profitable, and businesses want to benefit from it. They are looking for ways to use resources that are currently wasted. Businesses are becoming more successful by creating online platforms. These platforms connect people who need services with those who provide them. Airbnb connects people who have extra space with travelers looking for a place to stay. Another example is Uber, which encourages people to use their own personal cars as taxis to make some extra cash in their free time.

Zoos today have a very important job: helping to breed animals that are in danger of disappearing. Some rare animals have trouble finding partners and having babies in the wild. A good zoo helps these animals live and have babies safely. Fewer wild species mean a higher chance that the remaining animals or plants will have very similar genes. Zoos have breeding programs to help animals. These programs allow animals born in zoos to live in the wild and improve the health of the animal population.

These accidents almost never happen. But boats and trains can each cause a bridge to fall down, and they do so in different ways. Bridges are most likely to collapse when a train hits them at high speed. Boats can cause damage because they are very big, even when they move slowly. Plan ahead for bridge failures to help avoid them. Technology can help us find weak parts in structures. Safer workplaces and better designs also help. These things all reduce accidents.

Pi was scared of the animals and jumped into the water. Then he remembers that there are hungry sharks in the water around him and realises his only option is to climb back into the lifeboat.  First, the animals in the lifeboat killed and ate each other. Then, only Pi and the tiger were still alive. Pi survived because Richard Parker, the tiger, was ill and not interested in food.

When Pi is 16, a new government is elected that his parents don't support.  Worried about the future, Pi's parents decide to close the zoo and emigrate to Canada.  The family ships some animals to North American zoos. They then travel to Canada by ship with the remaining animals. There was a very bad storm during the voyage. The ship could not stay afloat and sank. Tragically, Pi's family and the ship's sailors all drown, but Pi finds himself in a lifeboat with a hyena, zebra, orang-utan and an enormous tiger.

The Hunger Games is a hugely successful book for teenagers and young adults by the American author Suzanne Collins.  It was published in 2008. Now it is available in 26 languages. It has sold millions of copies worldwide. This book is the first one for young people to sell over one million digital copies. The Hunger Games became a successful Hollywood film. In North America, it made $152.5 million when it first came out.

We may dream because our brain is organizing our daily thoughts. These thoughts often appear as symbols in our dreams. When we are awake, we usually think using words. During sleep, brain activity changes: language areas become quieter, and emotion areas become louder.

Having good relationships is a big part of being happy.  People who are happy often have close relationships with their friends and family. Sharing your personal feelings with someone is important. We call this 'self-disclosure'. Just one person for a heart-to-heart is enough, together with a network of other relationships.  You need more in friendships than just sharing interests like music or sports. A strong connection is key. To have good relationships, people should learn how to listen carefully.

This person is a psychologist and supports the idea of a 'growth mindset'. We can all get better at things, according to Carol Dweck. Our brains can adapt and learn new skills. We often focus on success and talent when we praise someone. You are good with details and planning events. If we praise how someone tries, experiments, and solves problems, they are more likely to learn and improve, according to research.

The rover looks at the air around it. In 2014, it found methane. Methane is a simple molecule and a part of natural gas. Methane breaks down after a few hundred years. This means something is adding more of it on Mars. NASA says Mars releases a lot of methane gas sometimes. The amount of methane in the air changes throughout the year, like the planet is breathing.

At the start of her work, the psychologist… Carol Dweck of Stanford University gave a group of ten-year-olds problems that were slightly too hard for them.  The first group liked the challenge. They also believed they could develop their skills. She says they believe effort leads to improvement, and they are planning for the future. Some kids thought people were checking how smart they are, and they felt they didn’t do well enough. They had a 'fixed mindset' and were unable to imagine improving.  These children reacted in different ways. Some said they might cheat again, and others tried to feel better by finding someone else’s bigger mistake.

Horror films are often set in places where no one lives. This could be an abandoned hospital, a scary empty house or a ghost town.  There's something about lonely, empty places.  Tell me about what it was like for people who lived there. Can you tell me why they departed? Sometimes, being very quiet can be scary, and that might be what's happening. Abandoned places are good for horror movies. People expect you can't get a phone signal there.

Basements are often scary in horror movies. That's usually where something is hiding or where the evil psychopath has hidden their tools.  Basements are dark. They are also often damp. You can only reach them by a narrow staircase.  Basements are usually scary, even when they are empty.

Gary Collins, an off-duty policeman, was watching the London riots on TV.  He quickly identified some people. Because of this, he ended his vacation early to assist with identifying others. He ended up spending six months going through the CCTV film and managed to identify 190 people, many from their eyes alone.  Without his help, the investigation would have been difficult. The software looked at a lot of video – 200,000 hours – but only found one person's face.

I find it interesting to consider how we might evolve faster as humans by changing our bodies. Imagine if you could implant a computer inside our brain!  We’ll soon be able to get better at math, understand things we see and hear, and remember information.

The talk was very interesting. The speaker explained some things very well. We can look at parents as an example. If parents use their phones for social media while doing other things, like cooking or waiting, it's difficult to ask teens to focus on homework without texting. She also made a valid point about people wanting to be in two or several places at once.  They have conversations with people both online and when they meet face-to-face. I see it all the time with my teenage daughter and her friends.  They agreed to meet. While sitting together, they each talked to different people online.

Although we hear a lot about violence, the situation isn't completely negative. From the end of World War II until 1990, wars were common. Thirty of them killed more than 100,000 people. Civil wars continue today, but countries are usually more peaceful now compared to the past. Recently, terrorism has become a bigger problem. Wars have killed mostly civilians since World War II. Even people who are not soldiers can find some good news in the statistics. Violent crime causes much more death than political conflict. Globally, the murder rate went down between 2000 and 2015, from 8 to 5.3 per 100,000 people.

Wasfia works hard to help people have basic rights. She has seen many projects in her country that help women and girls get education and training. However, these projects often end without giving lasting support. Bangladesh needed improvement, Wasfia thought. She decided to use her passions for climbing and human rights to help women in her country. She learned to climb while working on aid projects in Tibet and Nepal. This is unusual because Bangladesh is a flat country and most people there have never seen mountains. More people are noticing her campaign, both at home and internationally, so it appears to be successful.

Most people think developing countries have serious problems. They often have extreme poverty, leaders who have too much power, and little chance for improvement. This is actually not the case. There is a large change taking place. In the last 20 years, over 700 million people have become wealthier and are no longer poor. Fewer children are dying from disease – six million fewer each year. More girls are attending school, and more people have clean water available.

Managers often balance negative feedback with positive comments to help people receive it better. When feedback happens too often, workers might believe positive comments aren’t honest. This reduces how much they value the feedback. Don’t only give praise to soften criticism. Use it to support and motivate good work.

I belong to an organization that wants to ban deadly robots. Forget the movie image of a terrifying Terminator stamping on human skulls and think of what's happening right now: military machines like drones, gun turrets and sentry robots are already being used to kill with very little human input.  The next step will be autonomous 'murderbots', following orders but ultimately deciding who to kill on their own.  This is clearly a bad idea and could be dangerous. Be careful about what you ask machines to do.

English is very popular worldwide. More people study it, and it is spoken in more places than any other language. However, Chinese has by far the greatest number of native speakers.  There seems to be little correlation between how many native speakers there are of a language and the number of learners, but there is a stronger link between the number of learners and how many countries have speakers.

The manager needs to talk to you. It's about your work on the recent project. You felt worried all weekend. You thought about what you might have done incorrectly.
